reviewText:
Early Access Review

No, please, tell me they're joking with this...

They are joking, right?


Now to the real stuff. This is the definition of pay to win. You can't do anything except get blasted by snipers unless you spend a few good bucks. Honestly I think this game is a joke. Not even worth your time. No tutorial, no real graphics that are original *cough* Mincraft *cough*, nothing. Just gamemodes filled with trolls. I get it, early access and whatnot, but honestly, PUT WORK INTO IT. Basically every game after Minecraft just copies their graphics, and this one is no different.

If there was a way to put like 15 thumbs down, I would do so. This game is a joke. The only actually ok gamemode is the survival one with zombies, but even then they are the most overpowered thing in existence (unless you spend money on good items, of course). Now, kids, don't rage at me for not liking a game you like, but this is horrid. I can't believe this game.

2/10 for cool zombie gamemode at least.

EDIT 2/8/2015: Okay, so this is my first time actually doing this. I never really do this kind of stuff. Mainly, because I'm lazy or something. But this game ♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off so much I had to write it. As people usually expect from a person's first review, it's okay, but not that good. My review was the first (And possibly the last.) time I actually cared about typing something in, other than some stupid over-used meme. Thanks all of you for reading my review!

Okay so here's my overall expirence with this game, and yes, I know that it's in Early Access":


Survival mode:

Here's a little pro and cons about this game (In my opinion):

Pros:
+ Easy to kill every player in the game because everyone is a noob at aiming
+ Self-pleasure when someone says that you're hacking
+ Makes a good Uninstall and Reinstall program because it's something like 1mb
Cons:
- 100% P2W
- Graphics are MLG
- Community's a piece of crap
- Half the gamemodes are worthless and are never played...
- Did I mention it's 100% P2W?

So to sum up, this game is a piece of crap that shouldn't be played and should rot in hell...

P.S. This game's 100% P2W... just sayin'...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The ♥♥♥♥ did I just play? This is hilariously bad, kinda like some kind of.....Uh....Uh...Well....CoD meets Minecraft? With ♥♥♥♥ tons of lag. I can't explain how I felt about this game, most of the time, it's not the kind of game that makes me rage, it's just so lame that I struggle to say anything about it. It just feels overall...Not good.

I played this game for the same reason that I play many other ♥♥♥♥♥♥ games. I wanna live the nightmare myself, I wanna see if it's as bad as people say, and it is.

Here are a couple more negative points.

-No matter what server I play on, the lag seems to be a real and permanent issue in all of them, close or far from me, and it gets really annoying. It's fascinating when you keep doing the Wesker shuffle all along the map.

-Hackers. ♥♥♥♥ing hackers. Oh, so you are a little ♥♥♥♥♥ that doesn't wanna play zombie in zombie mode, and you just wanna hole like a ♥♥♥♥? Well, worry no more! There is a hack that allows you to zombify everyone! Even the ones that are really far away from you where you will NEVER ♥♥♥♥ING REACH THEM! And people seem to accept and even embrace that, what a ♥♥♥♥ing load of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.

-Every game mode, except for zombies, gets boring really quickly. Wait, nevermind, even zombies gets boring really quick, it's like mixing minecraft with CS zombie mods. Sounds good? Well, hackers and holing up forever and ever ruins that. You can build your own overpowered camping spot were you won't be reached.

-Clipping through the map. Believe me, it happens. No, it's not fun when you are holed up nice and snug and you fall to the floor below.

-Tank sounds. It's just a crappy sounding 1 or 2 second loop that not only feels like a cheap, poorly looped sound file, but also gets irritating in seconds.

-Zombies seem to be longarms, cuz they reach you from 3 or 4 blocks away when you are not behind one.

+It's funny when some dumb kid calls you a hacker because you can do stuff they can't. Never gets old.

-This game is blatantly pay to win. Sure, you get some rewards after you level up enough, but the best of the best when it comes to guns can ONLY be bought from the store. Plus, the ♥♥♥♥ing armor! Basically, if you pay, you can get armor that makes it harder for people to kill you with bodyshots,  and a helmet that basically gives you two chances to be headshotted. Yeah, seems balanced to me.

-This game is culturally diverse, you can find people from every filthy corner of this planet. The downside? They all seem to be minecraft humping squeakers with fascination for building ♥♥♥♥♥ and stuff like that. What a community!

-Some griefers in zombie mode just wanna see the world burn....YOUR world. They will destroy your bases and walls no matter what, or they will intentionally get close to the zombie's reach when holed up just to infect their whole team in there. What for, do you ask? POINTS. ♥♥♥♥ING POINTS.

Even if it's hilarious at times, the pain is not worth the gain.

Well, at least controlling guns ain't that hard, and the menu music is half decent :P

So what can a simple woman like me do with this? I dunno, I guesss I could join the grief train and try to have fun.....Or better yet, PLAY ANOTHER ♥♥♥♥ING GAME.
Stay away from this one, unless you want to torture yourself.

Did I said that the noise is loud? Like loud enough to cause permament ear damage to whoever was playing this game with headphones.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Many issues ruin what could be an FPS version of King Arthur's Gold.

-P2W, you CAN grind weapons, but considering you can just buy them, it makes it insanely hard to grind.
-lag issues, stuttering is common, especially when you are surrounded by lots of blocks (underground is really bad with this.)
-bad community, I've had moments where I genuinely couldn't tell if someone was being sarcastic or not with ther CoD kiddie like behavior.
-bad map design, most of the maps are either barren fields with trees and an occasional landmark or an arena-esque setting. There is also a permanent layer of fog that makes sniping with the defualt weapons practically impossible.
-sounds, almost everything in this game sounds horrible, mostly due to poor loops, low quality, or just sounding out of place, special mention goes to the sound when you drive a tank, which is so poorly looped you can hear the start of the sound byte at the start/end of the loop.
If you are willing to deal with technical problems, grind or pay, and are okay with putting the MS-paint icon on your desktop, it could be an acceptable guncraft clone.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Now for a serious review:

I couldn't fully enjoy this game and get more playtime in it due to the cons. I feel like I would've enjoyed and played the game a lot more if it only wasn't so P2W.
I haven't personally expirienced any bans yet, I have no idea what the other reviews are talking about.

Pros:

- Fast paced
- Only 80MB
- Has team and general chat
- 8 Gamemodes (Actually 9, but look in cons), including 'Zombie' 'Tank' and 'carnage'.

Cons:

- It's literally P2W. 90% of the weapons you 'unlock' you have to buy in the shop. Some P2W items include:
1. A rocket launcher
2. A helmet which basically makes your health 50% increased
3. Miniguns
5, There are 77 P2W weapons you can buy. Yes, I counted them. You can also buy some kind of tank.
6. That number doesn't include the amount of grenades, armor, dynamite, reinforced blocks and other stuff you can buy.  They offer a mega back including 'all weapons' for 50 dollars. And I mean STEAM FUNDS.
You unlock SOME weapons by ranking up, but you only get a limited (And small) amount of ammunition, and after you've used those up, you need to buy the weapons in the shop.

- 'Build' gamemode , in where you can build your own map, is only enabled for 'private' servers.
- Private servers are servers that you can set up yourself, but you need to be a premium member to do that.
And to nobody's suprise: Being a Premium member will cost you $1.60. For one week. So after seven days, you lose your premium status.

- A LOT of servers that the game runs are empty.

- Lack of costumisation options. All the options are:
~ Mouse sensitivity,
~'tileset', You can choose from 5 different standard texture packs,
~'dynamic' Light on or off,
~resolution , which goes pretty high. Which is good.
~ Render distance 'near' 'middle' and 'far'
~ fullscreen on or off

Cheers.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

BLOCKADE 3D is an free-to-play online first person shooter that is currently in Early Access that has been both developed and published by Shumkov Dmitriy. As you can see from the screenshots, it takes its visual style from Minecraft, but also throws in placing and destroying blocks as well, which allows you to edit the maps that you play on as you go. The game modes this game has are:

Battle:
4-way king of the hill. Capture and hold the centre of the map to earn points. Not sure how many points you need to win. It doesn't say.

Zombie:
Because it's not a game without one...
A PvP zombie mode. Surivors v Zombies. One player is chosen to be a zombie and the Suvivors have 15 seconds to prepare. When a Zombie hits a Survivor once, they turn into a Zombie. Zombies have one life. Zombies win by killing all the Survivors and the Survivors win by surviving for 4 minutes and 45 seconds.

This game mode is rather poorly executed. In the 15 seconds that the Survivors have to prepare, groups of about 3-5 will run into the nearest building and will create an impenetrable fort by finding the nearest empty room and filling it with blocks in such a way so that they can see you from all the way at the back of the room. but you can't get to them, as the room is filled with blocks which allows them to gun you down if you attempt to get anywhere near them. Combining the fact that Zombies only have one life and the fact that Suriviors can place blocks at their free will tips the scales so far in favour of the Survivors that its just plain rediculous. Now, if the Zombies had more than one life, then I could see this being a better game mode overall but it gets boring very quickly, regardless of what side you are on.

See the following pictures for example:
http://puu.sh/j6gxu/44c70676aa.jpg
http://puu.sh/j6gyI/60e4d96f03.jpg

Capture:
Not capture the flag. This is an 4-way area control gamemode. The map is split up into 16 squares and capturing a square will passively give points to your team. Capture a square by eliminating any other players that are on different teams that are in that square. Get 5000 points to win.

Versus:
Team Deathmatch. Teams Red and Blue fight to the death to be the first team to reach 500 points. Simple.

Carnage:
Melee only Team Deathmatch. Same as above, except melee only.

Survival:
PvE Zombie survival. Work together with up to 31 other players to survive waves of zombies.

Tanks:
Team Deathmatch again. But with tanks.

Now, onto the important question.

Is this game actually any good?
Meh. It's okay. Not the best game in the world, nor is it the worst. But I'm just gonna be straight here. It isn't really worth your time. The game isn't very exciting or gripping for an 'action' game. The community is probably most likely filled with children but who knows? Really, who knows. I mean, the game does have a leveling system. However, you are given the bare bones and the rest of the stuff you have to pay for. Not sure if you can get the stuff through the leveling system but probably not. But at the end of the day, this game is free-to-play. You aren't losing out on anything if you were to download it and play it just for giggles. I can't really shun this game that much because it's not like I forked out £15+ to play it. It was free.

I'd assume that you wouldn't actually download a silly looking game like this and actually PAY for anything, would you? I mean, no one can be THAT stupid, right?

...
Right?

Conclusion:I don't reccomend this game. Aimed at a young audience. It has no real nutritional value for people who are actually sentient. There are plenty of other foods out there that are not only better for you but are less likely to give you heart disease or diabetes so yeah.
Keep looking.

p.s. This game needed at least one semi-serious review.

Grind for nothing: You try to level up to get better guns obviously. But, the problem is, the guns you get are still bad. And the grind is just painful with all the Pay2Win...


Thats my small review.

Rating. 4/10 - Pay2Win

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is by far one of the most poorly designed early access FPS games I've ever played. It has a lot of problems, one of the most obvious being that it has shamelessly ripped off Minecraft's and Ace of Spades' design. All I have to say is at least this game is free, oh wait it's only free to play" meaning this basically is another one of those pay to win titles. The part about this game that ticked me off the most is the horrible community of seven-year-olds who play this game. These little brats have some serious issues
date: and I mean SERIOUS issues. You walk a whole five steps in this game and you are automatically a government database hacker! I'm not joking when I say I had at least twenty or so kids called me a hacker the instant I shot one of them. That's another thing too
recommended: this game pretty much fails at including any modern-day fps game mechanics. Apparently it didn't occur once to whoever spent their time developing this game that they maybe should've added some spray patterns or at least something to break up the one click headshots. When it comes to the game's capabilities I have to say that I'd rather go on over to GameJolt.com and play some crappy Slender ripoffs. Speaking of which
hoursPlayed: they have this top-notch quality Slenderman skin that you can buy for only THREE DOLLARS. KUP TERAZ EVERYBODY! May I just say for the record that it's absolutely pointless to even call a game "Free to Play" when you basically would have to spend over 300$ just to get all of the game's included content? Come on guys

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Never in my life, have I met a bad game. (other than Brink...)
Lets start with the basics. You, as a fellow player, have just 3 primarys, a pistol, shovel, and TEH HOELY Brick. The Brick is used to build defenses when you get incoming fire. Why I find this stupid is because any a**hole in your team can easily destroy it, making the Brick rather useless. Imagine yourself where you are taking heavy fire, and need to take cover. You build a little fort to secure yourself, and OUT OF NO WHERE YOUR TEAMMATE DESTROYS YOUR FORT, THE BLOODY IDIOT GETS KILLED AND YOU GET KILLED. Sorry, my anger got the best of me. Lets talk about the weapons, YAY. Your weapons feel all the same. You get a SMG, a single shot rifle, and a shotgun. The SMG, is weak and USELESS. I felt like I was shooting a Nerf gun with this thing, dafuq?! The single shot rifle; OH MY GAWD TEH HEEDSOTS. This is one of the strongest first weapons when you start the game, since it gets heedsots left and right. The shotgun! I haven't used it that much, so I can say much about it. BUT WHO CARES!? Is might be like the others, terrible. Multiplyer, is broken. On every single server I've been on, there is AT LEAST one hacker. AT F*CKING LEAST ONE! Not only that, but spawn camping IS HUGE in this game. Walk out of spawn, boom ded. Walk out of spawn AGAIN, boom ur ded, not big surprise. It SICKENS me. But hey, at least the maps are great. Right? No. The maps feel, NO, ARE, all the same. Either is a little sqaure map, or a big map with 4 corners with all the 4 teams.
I just can't anymore. This is the worst game I have EVER played. I wasted almost a hour in this s**t.  I'm BEGGING you, PLEASE, DO NOT PLAY THIS 'GAME'. Please, move along, and find a different game to play, just not this turd. Hey, I heard Team Fortess 2 is also a FPS, you should try it out :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I will admit, I like the way this game plays. Something about it makes it have somewhat smooth gameplay and is as casual as you can get with a game. People have described this as a combination of Counter-Strike and Minecraft; I agree with that.

You start off the game like any freemium FPS game online. There's a server tab, a shop" tab
recommended: etc. It's what you expect. Gamewise
hoursPlayed: it's a blocky Counter-Strike that lets you lay blocks like Jagex's "Ace of Spades". The first game I entered was a blatant rip of Aztec (with a few edits) from CS:GO and all you have to do is have your team reach 500 frags. Now I don't know if I just suck or there are hackers because I noticed many people doing consistent headshots with AKs
voteText: snipers
helpfulPercent: and tons of grenades being thrown. Next game I joined was a "zombie" mode map. Whatever they did with the view range
votesHelpful: I do not know - I could not see 10 feet ahead as there was a very black fog. The whole map was covered in camping spots with one entrance where you can wall yourself in (ala block building) until the end of the round.\n\nAs far as buying guns goes
votesTotal:
I don't understand it. I saw the tab and every gun was blocked by 1) level requirements and 2) a $ currency. I am not sure if it's real life money or ingame. I would be surprised if it was real life as some of those guns are over $1 each. That's way too expensive.

The game just didn't capture my attention or give me enough fun for me to keep on playing so I uninstalled the game. It's still in early access so there's time for it to get better and I hope it does. I like the overall game but still it has a long way to go to be good. I'll admit the gun models look nice for blocks.

Game runs great. I ran it on my "medium" laptop unplugged on power saver mode while running some stuff in the background at around ~30 FPS.

Obligatory Score: 5/10 (Early Access)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game has opportunity, but there are a few problems.
One of the most noticeable things is the lag.
I didn't seem to have any lag of any sort, but it seems alot of people did.
I'm not sure if the game's servers atm have terrible connections, or those who complained about lag have somewhat lower-end PCs.
Now the thing that i worry about the most, is that it is Pay2Win.
Sure, games like TF2 were pay2win, but atleast you can unlock things by playing for a while. And i mean like a WHILE.
But in this game you can't pay less than atleast 30 cents to get a single thing.
And coming off the topic of Pay2win, comes the unbalanced guns.
The only gun that i could find that isnt insanely OP was the MP5.
The M14 can do insta kills in the head, and two shot if in body.
M3 is a bit hard to use, but it's OP for sure. 1 shot kill if your'e about 3 blocks away.
MP5 was your average assault weapon. From what i've seen from using this, it's pretty well balanced. (Except for the fact that you'll get more deaths to a M14 or M3 than kills with MP5.)
So over all:
I give a 5.5/10
I'll stay for the long haul to see if anything changes, but as of now Blockade isn't my favorite.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is possibly the worst free to play game I have ever had the unfortunate opportunity to witness. I was just going to do a joke review but there's already so many describing how bad this game is that I don't really need to.

Art-wise, this game just tries to ride off the popularity of another game, ace of spades. A decent and fun game that went to ♥♥♥♥ as soon as Jagex got their grubby hands on it, but enough of them. So you have the OH SO ORIGINAL block building based game. How exciting and not overused!

The community is absolutely atrocious. Filled with hackers in every server and children that ♥♥♥♥ talk about how good they are because they stole their parents credit card to pay for armor and instant kill machine guns and snipers. Which brings me to this.

This game is the poster child of pay to win. YOU HAVE TO PAY FOR EVERYTHING IN THIS GAME!  Asides the M14, the starting guns and early unlocks are terrible. everyone else thats 10 levels higher than you or wearing armor will destroy you. watch as people wearing armor they paid real money for use machine guns get 100+ kills on the server and you struggle to manage 20. get ready to be spawn camped by another team and see half the server move to the winning sides team.

There is a progression system that lets you eventually unlock new weapons, most of them are just useless weapon like secondaries or smg's. some of which can take a whole magazine to kill an armored player while you have the pleasure of being 1 shot killed from any gun. And I forgot to mention, every gun is 100% accurate. Theres no recoil. every gun feels almost the same in terms of everything except firerate (with the exceptions of shotguns range).
levelling up gets you grenades, healthkits and rockets, but a limited amount that you will end up using all of it and then have to wait for either another level or buy them.

That's pretty much the gist of this game. And there are now so many free to play games that are almost carbon copies exactly like this all over steam. So Thanks Valve. You're truly doing a fantastic job with this early access crap.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Lost it's value because it's become Russians banning people and charging them to be unbanned. Avoid this ♥♥♥♥ scam of a game.

Update: Posted information on a forum that I felt would be accurate here.

Blockade is a scam and I was sad to realize it. Fainter(the forum developer) doesn't code(from what I understand)... and he is just public relations(not too friendly either). This game used to actually require strategy, but it's just a solid pay to win game now. It's popular amongst kids because mommy's credit card can buy superior items making winning as easy as breathing in real life. These kids feel like they are good at something when it's just the money that allows them to win. I knew a few people who could destroy any pay to win kid without paying a penny(damage and Zetti amongst a few). Savage was bad but got good scores because he played against level 3's and 4's who hadn't spent a penny whereas he bought every single item. He rage quit because he was still bad even after paying to win. That's my rant on the players. The game itself is an obvious russian knockoff of CS:GO and Minecraft. It's a money scheme made by 4 Russians. If someone is too dull to see something this painfully obvious and still wants to pay for stuff in game... then they can waste their money. Fainter once used the excuse of food money and whatnot, but at this rate they could buy a house with the money scammed from gullible children.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nLet me start out by saying yes this is a fun game and to some point it is and can be a pay-to-win game, but after the game updated a lot of guns can be unlocked by ranking up. This isn't a CoD game. It takes way more skill. why? well I'll tell you. A lot of guns are very strong, main ones being shot guns, snipers and a few AR's. You'll either suck badly or you'll dominate. You won't find kill cams in this game so learn where the shot spots are or learn to play better. Yes there are a few issues with the game but it's not as bad as people are making you believe. Please try the game yourself and don't listen to these minecraft fanboys. Seriously... xD. I actually play this more than CoD because it takes more skill and its fun to watch people call you a hacker just because you're better than them. Lag is minimal actually, its the latency that gets you killed. Hit detection is great. Sorry for any misspelled words.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You thought minecraft was good? You're a fan of the CoD series? You will love this....
Get ready for the most immersive and combat accurate shooter out there to date. Graphics are full 1080p and will look so good it will appear to be real and give you the feeling you are in the combat zone itself.

Some scrubs say this masterpiece is P2W? Well they're wrong. Your peashooter balanced gun can take down any pay to win child in only 24 head shots and 48 if you hit body-shots. The same scrubs also say the helmet you can by at the ridiculously low price of $0.99 is overpowered.... Like come on guys, when has surviving 3+ headshots been overpowered?
You can unlock 3 amazing and balanced peashooter guns from the beginning and progress your character until you are a skilled veteran of the game...  Or cough up mommie's credit card number and spend $50 and make yourself one of those pay to win scrubs The levelling on this game is brilliant and a prime example for future games.

The game's community itself is purely magnificent. Everyone takes losing well and absolutely no-one calls out hacker once they are killed. Every single member of the community is a trusted individual and are always good sports who take losing well and spawn camping is completely obsolete on the game. (trust me it never happens, no-one is that cheap in their kills).

Do you just love running into that loud mouthed child who randomly appears in every game and ruining it improving the atmosphere? Do you love how he calls out 'Hacker' or 'noob' after every death? Well that's great too because this game attracts all those people together so then can bond and forge good relations.

Literally the best game ever, you have to play it for it will be an 'experience' like no other game" can offer.

9.8 / 10 - IGN
Thank you Blockade 3D for soaking up some of the children from the more advanced (and inferior) games on steam and 'taking one for the team' in your "Under 12 only Russian" community. Thank you for enduring the suffering so we don't have to....
This is my favorite game right after Airport Simulator 2014."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright, so.. you might be thinking that the bad reviews of this 'game' are exaggerated and you're thinking in downloading this free somewhat good-looking game, right?

DON'T.


This game is awful in all ways.

The game is too basic, it looks like they made it on Unity or some free cheap engine and used Paint to make the textures.

The shop where you buy weapons is EXTREMELY pay to win, you CAN'T unlock weapons for free. (This also includes skins)

The community is OUTRAGEOUS, the first server I entered to had a kid bragging about how he made 10 dollars with CS:GO as another player praised him like he is some kind of god.. I don't even want to imagine the other servers.

There is NO tutorial, you just join a server and for some short time it'll just throw you in a loading screen showing you what are the controls (which by the way some of them are in other languages, I do believe it's Russian).

The gameplay is very clunky, for example.. if you jump and place a block above you there is a chance you will get stuck into the block and you will get disconnected from the server shortly after.

And last but not least.. the servers are very limited, there is only servers from Russia, United States and Europe. (So you can expect bloody inmense amounts of latency (a.k.a lag))

This game has potential.. but the developer(s) must change a lot of things in order to make it a succesfull product.

My final veredict is 1/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Remember Ace of Spades, before it was turned into a turd that went against everything it was about?

Ace of Spades was a great little title for an unfinished Alpha. Weapons hit hard as they should, building a trench or wall was a MUST if you wanted to hold your position and survive, let alone deal with snipers in more open ended maps, maps where fairly large and could be mangled to fit whatever your needs were.. A shame the game is pretty much dead from last I saw (let alone a popular playground for cheaters), because it was a pretty damn good game that mixed building stuff and breaking stuff together and showed that both could be used to make for some fun matches.

And then came games like the current Ace of Spades, Guncraft, and even Blockade 3D here, who all share the same major problem: Building is a waste of time that gets you killed more than anything, and when you do build something, it just ends up hindering you more than helping, showing that all it is good for is pluging up entry points (which even then only lasts for a second before a rocket blows your blockade wide open).

But, see... While this game attempts to emulate the feel of playing classic Ace of Spades (going so far as to have a few assets that feel like they were illigaly taken right from the source), in reality it is probably the worst contender for Voxel-based builder and shooter, or should I say just shooter, since it fails in the building part.

See, while the classic and Current version of Ace of spades and Guncraft gives you what you pay for, this game is Free to play, but also it is free to play in the worst possible way in that every gun in the game besides the starter kit (and a select few unlockables that you gain though unlocking) require you to pay money for them, as well as all manner of gear such as helmets, TNT blocks, med kits and all sorts of other gear.

Now, this isn't totally bad... Most guns are modestly priced, with some of the cheapest guns and a fair number of gear under a buck.. However, rather than allowing you to buy any gun from the start, the game has a leveling system that locks certain guns out, limiting your selection and making it hard to find a good gun to buy early on. It could lead to some wasteful purchases, buying a gun only to discover it is worthless compared to higher grade guns, some of the biggest guns costing 4-5 bucks, said guns being a minigun, an AA-12, and even a heavy sniper rifle that can kill a fully armored target in a single shot, and can make helmets worthless.

By the way, some of the guns you can buy are also rip-offs, weapons that are hardly worth the investment compared to other far better guns that can be aquired at the same price (or even less), meaning that you run the risk of wasting money. With the leveling system limiting what you can buy, as well as the risk of wasting money on sub-par guns, this could be the dev's way of multi-dipping into your pockets and making you spend more than you want to spend on a F2P title. Did I mention that there is also a lot of gear that is limited and can only be refilled either by buying them or as a small level-up reward?

Fans will argue that yes, you can get a selection of free guns, and every level up gives you a small reward package of free nades, medkits, rockets and TNT blocks. While the latter is somewhat useful, the guns you do get are still nothing compared to what you could get if you put money in the game. Sure, some of them pack a nasty punch, but even then they don't have the benifits that some of the better paid guns have (such as large ammo clips, helmet-piercing, high rates of fires, and in one case a grenade launcher that used ammo that you buy that packs on hell of a punch).

And mind you, I was just babbling on about the guns. There is also other problems, like how insultingly small the 2 team VS maps are, how the 4 team Battle mode tends to get horribly unbalanced at times (which, by the way, no auto balance, so expect some really unbalanced odds often), with some of the teams focusing more on spawn camping than on completing the objective (and for good reason, since you get nothing for winning but all sorts of XP for killing people), and.. I hardly really played the other modes, but they were so forgettable that I guess that alone is enough to say about them. And of course, there is a cheating problem, but that is common in a lot of F2P titles, so it isn't worth noting.

I don't like screaming pay to win, but this game certainly does smell of it, what with how the only decent weapon a F2P even has is a battle rifle that can one-shot people in the head.. Unless they have a helmet, then it takes two shots, which further proves how the dev really wants to get you to spend money on either getting better protection for your skull so you don't die as fast or a gun that can bypass said protection and make it a wasted investment that only serves to screw with free players. Not only does it stink of P2W, it also is an insult to building block shooters, where the one thing that could make it easier for a F2P player (building cover), is made pointless with how it only serves to slow you down and get in the way instead of providing cover that can help save your life and allow you to shoot from a covered position. It's all just run in and try not to die, and thus a waste of the engine.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Like we haven't had enough Minecraft-Inspired FPS, and it got old after the 10th clone.
This clone however, is one of the worst offenders, so far. It suffers from some awful issues that anybody who developed a frontal lobe could notice. Which is why a portion of the community hasn't.

Balancing Issues:
The M14 practically dominates the field. It's a one shot kill if you aim for the head, which isn't hard because the heads are freaking huge and way too easy to aim at in this game. It's a two-three shot kill with bodyshots. It would be fine if the other guns wouldn't be utter crap compared to the M14. The M3 shotgun is a one shot kill, yes, but only if you're up at the enemy's face. He would probably pop an M14 round into your skull before you even get close, especially when the only GOOD maps are the expansive ones. The MP5 is garbage, it takes way too long to kill someone, about half a mag. No one ever uses it. The pistol is the exact same thing as the MP5 with a smaller magazine. Pretty much use the M14 and be average at aiming and you'll be good. Which is the problem. Just look at the kill counter on the top and you'll see it's nothing but LittleBoy123 Killed BrazilianGuy098 with a headshot and M14!".

Lag. A Whole lot of it:
It's crazy how much lag there can be. The US servers couldn't be worse. I keep seeing my character jump back a few steps

Early Access Review

I don't think there's any game I'll ever be able to be so blunt about.

Don't. Just don't.
This game is a balancing nightmare, if you don't have money to drop on it you can only use three weapons, two of which are garbage, and one of which is a 1-2hit kill at any range. Meanwhile, the weapons you have to spend money for (real money too, there's no ingame way to unlock anything other than defaults) way outclass the default things, and there are also vehicles that are also only behind a paywall.

Even the paid version of Ace of Spades would be a better choice.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Did you always wanted to die without any real chance to defend yourself?
Did you always wanted to play a game that looks like somebody cloned minecraft and attached guns to it and made it p2w?
Do you have low/no standards when it comes to video games?
Then this is for you.

Blockade3DBlockade3D is a a first person shooter made by a horrible gamedeveloper.
The gameplay is ok,if it were not for 1 thing

almost everything in the game except for a shotgun,a silenced pistole,the ak47,a sniper and another automatic rifle at lvl 13 is locked and you have to pay irl money for it.But wait,thats not the end of it! You can't directly buy everything as a lvl 1, you have to level up and then you can spend your money on things. Real life money of course.Yep,its p2w.

GameplayThis game is the base game for another game which lacks knockback and bulletspread on weapons. These are thing for a reason,to not be able to snipe people with a fricking minigun over a larger distance.
This game is a tidious grindfest where you have to play hours to get 1 level, and don't think about making privat rooms,because you need Premium for it.
OverallIf you want to play a minecraft like game with guns just go back get minecraft instead and look for a gunmod- There are many. You will probably have more fun in that game then in this piece of ♥♥♥♥ anyways. Spending money on this game,to confirm the information,gives you a huge advantage over others. Sure the stuff you can get for free might be good,but the stuff you can buy with irl money is still better. Just a shame that every dollar earned with this game goes straight into the servers,he should do what any sane scammer does:run away with the money and shut down the servers after a while.Would probably for the best anyways.
I cannot recommend a game like this, and im suprised that trash like this even has a fairly mixed rating,considering what other game this guy made.(he literally made a minecraft clone. its not completly the same but worse(that is for a different review however) .
The uninstall button is free through.
If you excuse me now, I will be bashing my head against the wall to forget that this game even exists.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At first I thought, Great game! You can mine stuff and kill people. It has smooth gameplay and nice graphics.

Well I was wrong, I was so wrong. Or should I say WRONG as this game loves its capitals.

Terrible.

Gameplay is good but everything needs real money. EVERYTHING!

Heavily pay to win.

It's basically a rip off of Roblox, Minecraft and Counter-Strike.

Sure it's 71mb but EVERY GUN NEEDS REAL MONEY! The default guns are alright but it's not fun being killed by premium players every 5 seconds because their guns kill you instantly.

If they ever fix the pay to win for this game, it may actually become a really good game.

2/10 - Don't Bother with it, go buy CS:GO or Minecraft instead.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DISCLAIMER!: This review was posted July 20, 2015. AS this is an early access game it can get better (but i don't think it will)

I've played this game for 11 minutes and I'm sorry to say this but this is the worst game I've ever played (btw i dont play that many games doh).

Pros:
-I guess it's not a big download
-The uninstall button

Cons:
-To kill it's either one headshot with the sniper or 20 bodyshots with the SMG
-Buying guns with your parents money is the only way to win
-Early Access
-One death noise and animation
-Pay to win
-MICROTRANSACTIONS
-The building aspect of this game is useless. People only use it to build bridges which didn't need to be there if the developer made the maps good
-Russian servers are the only good ones in the game
-Zombies don't respawn in the zombie mode meaning that it's like 5 zombies vs 5 people with guns instead of an overwhelming heard of zombies
-Pro tip: if you aim the gun 2 blocks high instant headshots
-Hackers are everywhere.

Final Verdict: Don't play this game. It is soooooooo bad. Play better FREE games like tf2 or planetside 2 or BARBIE DRESSUP anything is better than this. If someone said they would give 20$ to play this game slap them in the face and take it as an insult. ITS NOT WORTH FREE.
10/10 -IGN / 10/10 -GAMESPOT

Early Access Review

Now were do i start. this amazing show of modern technology is the epitome of modern gaming, everything about this game screams next gen and its even better because its free to play and the games engine is just one of the most impressive game engines i have ever seen and being an avid gamer i tend to play a lot of games and none can compare to this next gen masterpiece that is BLOCKADE 3D
to start my review off ill begin with everyones question why the capital letters in title"? well the first answer is how many of those bad games had lower-case titles not this one BLOCKADE 3D reachs above and beyond with its modern stance on titles.
the second part of this review will be pointing out everything about this game that draws you in
date: EVERYTHING the graphics are that good i was nearly brought to tears by them i had to take a rest from playing just to take in everything in those textures they were just so amazing
recommended: next is the best shooter gameplay to ever grace the planet i am so glad to see how modern shooters are changing and evolving to one up each other but id like to see the next cod out do this beauty of a game\nanother great feature of this game is its anti-misogynistic character design as it never refers to you player with a gender (and its obvious that women are more powerful than men) so its safe to asume that all the characters are female it also has a very anti-semetic appeal to it as the main story is about a strong (what i asume as a nazi) women empowering other nazi women through the medium of blocks and these blocks are used to represent the moral and values the hitler himself once believed in and in a typical tripple A game you dont see such depth in the gameplay with such subtle references to a great historical event its just so hard for modern games to develop such rich and life like character in a game\nTL:DR BLOCKADE 3D is the equivalent to colour tv or the moonlanding you only see a masterpiece like this one in a 1000 years im just glad this amazing game happened to be made in my lifetime"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There's something strangely satisfying about blowing people's brains out in this game. Maybe it has something to do with the fact that I just assume everyone playing this is under 13 years old. Best part is how they all have their country's flag next to their names so I can know where I'm spreading my American influence.

I just wish it wasn't a broken, unstable mess.

It crashes constantly, the rounds just end without warning, and every time I die, my mouse can freely move to my other monitor and mess my whole world up. Needs fixin.

My favotire part is when kids, who are decked out in about $40 of real life ACTUAL DOLLARS worth in armor and weapons, complain when you shoot them with rocket launchers because it's unfair and takes no skill, as they absorb bullets like it's nothing, while spraying 1000 bullets a second, each that kill people (who didn't spend $40 of real life ACTUAL DOLLARS worth in armor and weapons) in about one shot.

Also, when they're losing, they just switch to the other team until there's 4 people on one side, and 30 people on the other. The team with 30 always seems to geuinely have fun with this as well. The people who play this game truly are a remarkable species.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

From the experience i've encountered with this game, it's not too bad of a game.

People who experience lag just have low mbps. But, there could be REALLY HUGE LAG SPIKES. (As I almost had to force quit the game.)
I somewhat agree with the physics and nature of the weapons. 1 shot to the head with the M3 shotgun/ M14 = death. A few bullets and shots to the chest= death. MP5= give or take 10 shots to the chest = death. A few shots to the head = death.

The HUUGE problem I have with this game is the selling of weapons. (Pay2win as its called) EVERYTHING IS OVERPRICED. Want a good assault rifle? Pay $3.00 and it's yours. Want a sniper? Too bad, cough up $2.50 and it's yours. Everything should be reasonably priced at $.10 - $1.00. (Some things can be a bit more priced but that's what i'd put a price on micro-transactions like these.)

Bugs... There were a few bugs. Not too much of a problem but, there are a few.

You cannot make a private server with friends... BUMMER MAN...

32 players... Wish it could be 64 players.

Servers are not placed for certain continents (North America, South America, Europe, etc.) It's all mixed around.

I can't say much about the game as it is in a Early Access." If they add

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been seeing reviews of this from people with 3 reviews (not saying I'm any better, I just don't like making these all to often) going and saying it's completely pay to win. There are games that are even more p2w than this that I've played, *cough* a lot of mmos, *cough* and yet, I see more complaints on this game about it. This game is, from what I've found, made by one person who clearly doesn't have a lot of money to be spending on development of this game. So, yes, they need some way of getting enough money to host it in the first place. It's completely different than what MMOs are doing nowadays. Most MMOs can host their servers without being payed from outside sources, but that money goes to development.

As of now, all the money spent in this game goes to hosting, meaning there isn't a budget for development of this. That's why the game is as bad as other says. I wouldn't recommend it as of now, but if the dev ever gets enough money to enhance the gameplay features and crack down on the hackers, I would gladly recommend it. As of now, I consider this game an alpha build. But that's just what I see from it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I love this fast-paced game, reguardless of the micro-transactions. But the people who decide to buy stuff ruin the game. I don't recomend this game because the cash bought weapons and armor are overpowered. In this game, there are one-shot-kill headshots. But you can prevent it by getting a helmet, or armor.
Pros: Fast-paced, Building, Ragdolls, Sniping, and much more.
Cons: Micro-transactions, sometimes to big or small maps, no team balance, no recoil, really low health.
Tips: If you decide to get this game, be ready to see younger players. This game has minecraft based graphics, which invite young to play. Sometimes people will buy weapons or armor, which helps turn the tide. If you are in a group thats losing, don't switch teams. People will be wanting to win, so they change teams. There is no auto-balance.
Bugs: random lag/ crashes (might be my problem), fullscreen doesn't work.
WARNING TO ALL SNIPER LOVERS: THIS GAME START WITH A SNIPER, BUT HAS NO SCOPE.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reasons not to download:
1). You need to pay for almost all the guns in the game.
2). The lag! GET CAT 8 CABLES FAZER!
3). It is hacker heaven because FAZER is too lazy to implement VAC (Valve anti-cheat).
4). No american servers.
5).

If FAZER (the only developer of the game at the moment) gets an ACCUAL dev team behind him, I'll delete this bad review if the game becomes good. P.S. I have spent too much money on this excuse for a minecraft meets FPS game and I want some ingame currency that you earn by:
1). Playing the game
or
2). Paying for packs of currency

So, now that is over with, I just don't like the game in general because of the lag and paywalls as well as general gameplay. I've found many game-breaking glitches, like falling through the ground and being kicked from a match for no reason. So, if you want a good FPS, DO NOT get this game. save your money for A game like Call of Duty: Black ops III
or something like that.

sincerely,
thegamingpatriot

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I installed it just to write a bad review..

You see, I liked the old Blockade game. Blockade: First Assault (1492) It was Indians versus Colombus, and you used bows. Then the second game (1992) Blockade 1D came out. It was basically FA with 2x the content. Then, Blockade: After Earth came out, featuring guns for the first time (2002). After that, (2012) Blockade: 2D came out. After that, (2014) Blockade 3D came out. I heard that they are going to stop development of this game to make a new Blockade game: Blockade: Your Mom's Credit Card Warfare.

1/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm going to say it, i usually don't, but i am...

This game sucks...

Summary:
If, no, On your smartphone, browse the app store. After a few minutes of looking through games and apps you'll usually find one of these shovelware games aka minecraft shooters". They are rushed
recommended:
and are pay2win. The demo they aim for is 6 year old minecraft lovers who cant afford 20$ to buy the actual thing. That's all fine and dandy but THEY DONT BELONG ON THE PC

Gameplay:
Clunky and horrible
hoursPlayed: nothing more. If you want to enjoy this game
voteText: get ready to dish out 30$+ to buy competent weapons. And the weapons... oh god.. The M14 is the best free weapon in the game. 1shot to the head is a kill
helpfulPercent: and with the heads being oh
votesHelpful: i don't know.. SUPER FREAKING HUGE
votesTotal: it's almost impossible to miss. the M3 sucks
votesFunny: and takes multiple hits to kill. the MP5 is just garbage. To enjoy this game
commentsCount: you need to pay for weapons.\nThey have several modes
column16: which i've played all except one. I couldnt get a good enough server to play it.\n* Deathmatch:  the only good mode
column18: zombies take multiple hits to kill
column20: one zombie hit will infect you
column21: though it seems if a zombie comes within a 3 mile radius of you
column22: you become infected.\n* Tank:  Nice concept
column23: just deathmatch with tanks.... if the tanks were actually playable. I'm assuming this will be fixed soon
column24: but its almost IMPOSSIBLE to drive
column25: and if you want to shoot and *gasp* actually kill someone
column26: you have to have the patience of a Tibetan monk.\n*Capture: CTF
column28:
though it seems it's impossible to win due to the guns being op.
*Carnage: Just hit each other with shovels. great..
Every server except for russian ones are laggy. Your character seems to jump back and forth with every step.


Graphics:
Mix between roblox and minecraft... this game doesn't even know what it wants to rip off. no sounds except guns and explosions. The tank sounds like a car.


The Good:
The uninstall button works just fine.

The Bad:
Everything. Especially the leveling system. It's broken as all hell. It seems impossible to level up.

Overall grade = D+
Yes
column29: i'm going to get hate for rashing on an game in EARLY ACCESS
column30: but games like these don't belong on the PC. If you want a minecraft-esque shooter
column31: i'd suggest buying Minecraft and downloading mods."

Have you played any shooter? But Too Mutch advanced tactics and other advance stuff, so you just wanna hang out? Its Your Game!

I recommend this game for players who wanna get better at aiming at heads, and for everybody...

9/10

AND YOU GET BANNED IF YOU PLAY GOOD

Gameplay 10/10
+Fast placed
+Instant respawn
+Tactical Levolution
+Not Levelbased
-Sometimes Spawnkilling

No Mice

Weapons 6/10
+Default free weapons are good
-A loot of Premium weapons
-♥♥♥♥ing helmets and bodyarmors just for premiums

Maps 10/10
+Battle Gamemode is awesome
+Zombie mod isnt bad

+Control Points in Battle mode are well builded
+Tactical building and levolution is usefull and needed

Community (10/10)

+Helpfull teammates and players
+You can Play with Friends"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You litrally have to pay for everything unless you want to stick with the starter stuff...

The lag on the servers is just stupid at times, you shoot 4 people in the head for example and then get headshot by them a moment later with all 4 still alive (and I've looked at my ping at that moment, it was 12 and i got all 4 hitmarkers).

Its not really that ready to be up here.. they need to put a progression into the game, not just make it so you have to buy everything to continue, or get anywhere.

Now I know its an 'early access' game but if thats the case you need have a bit more to show, its very bare at the moment. I do play alot of Early Access games but this isn't really much to show yet :/

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros of Blockade 3D:

+ The gunplay is okay, I guess.
+ Small amount of creativity, I guess.
+ Uninstalls easily.
+ Netcode is okay.

Cons of Blockade 3D:
- Pretty much Freemium, you won't stand a good chance unless you bought guns with your hard-earned money.
- Shovel is OP pls nerf
- Hardly any starting blocks.
- No options menu, or FoV sliders.
- Doesn't show ping of servers you connect to.
- Mute doesn't always work.
- Automatically starts you off in-game with VoIP on.
- A lot of bugs.

Conclusion:
It is okay for an hour or so, then you start getting bored. Only play if you have friends who wants something simple to play, otherwise, Team Fortress 2 or Planetside are objectively better options. Would not recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I installed the game and joined a random server only to be told by two, potentially young English players to leave. This game is plagued with: a lack of the all-important assessment mode for newcomers; the inability to create a free server (between public and private); a stunning lack of mature players; hackers; and much, much more. I'll cut BLOCKADE 3D some slack since it's an early access title.

Overall score: 5/10 -- Needs improvement.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tl;Dr: I cannot recommend the game; The game is pay to win and the community is quite bad. However, when these issues aren't too prominent the game is fun.

Yeah, I had a review before that said that this game wasn't pay to win and was actually good.

Needless to say, I pulled that because that was not correct. I really wanted this game to be good, but I can't honestly say it is.

It's pay to win
Non-paying players cannot get helmets or armor, which gives an unfair advantage to paying players. Having played both with and without armor, I can honestly say that I got a better K:D ratio with armor on. Also, I bought a high-capacity gun, giving more of a noticable advantage. Finally, though I did not buy this, you can pay for a premium" account (which is a subscription). This gives you double experience. Again
date:
I did not buy this but this is how it is advertised and is stated by other players.

The community is terrible
This isn't something I usually like to say is bad about a game
recommended: but it's pretty terrible. I've argued with BeastX
hoursPlayed: the top #1 player. He heavily insisted that the game was not pay to win
voteText: despite the fact he actually stated it was pay to win (he stated that the game gave an advantage to paying players). Also
helpfulPercent: he calls those who don't want to pay "poor kids." Keep in mind that this is exactly how the majority of the community thinks and acts. They reject those that talk badly of the game
votesHelpful: saying that they are bad or poor.\n\nAlso
votesTotal: I've been called racist terms and have been in a server when someone started chanting "F*** AMERICA." The non-American portion of the community can be quite hostile towards Americans.\n\nHowever
votesFunny: it is still a bit fun\nWhen the previously mentioned issues aren't being particually bothersome
commentsCount: the game is fun. I've gotten good kill sprees and the game is
column16: on paper
column21: the game would be very good.\n\nStill
column22: I cannot honestly set the review as a recommend. The fact is that the two issues I mentioned are far too prominent."

date: the "normal" gamemode here in Blockade. I will not say much about the other gamemodes.\n\nSo

voteText: seriously easy. Even without paying and with the starter weapons

column17: no. The Voxel based Maps are more complex that you'd think. There are a crap ton of tactics to get to the objective and keep the other teams from doing it
column20: are damn satisfying.\nYou can destroy bridges
column23: set up sniped outposts and checkpoints etc. The MOST satisfying thing tough is
column24: when you destroy all the blocks that keep a building in the air
column25:
making for example a whole skyscraper hit the ground and destroying a major sniping place for the enemy.

HAX?!The good part: I can answer this question with one simple word: No.
Even tough you  may read a lot of "Moooom this game is full of hacker! ;_;" reviews

once you pay a bit it really depends on skill. 2 Players with Body Armor and RPK have to be really prescise as every shot counts. Any "filthy F2P peasant" trying to interrupt doesn't stand a chance and is pretty much instantly killed.

So?
If you happen to be in a match without any Payers

it won't work out too well. This is not a game to make big castles or such as there are a crap ton of Pyromaniacs in this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Upon playing this game you can get HIGH fps. Alot of people in thier reviews complain that this is a P2W (Pay to Win) game. Upon leveling up you unlock weapons. There are alot of stuff you can buy in the shop, some are OP and others arent.

Game is in the early stages, no Anti-Cheat system in place which means there are a lot of people who are using cheats. At this stage It may not be worth playing for people because of the cheaters, I think when a system comes in place that people will like it alot more. Another thing about this game is that the physics are not all there. There is no recoil, no gravity on your bullets (you can shoot a LMG across map and get instant headshots).

The biggest thing that bugs me about this game is the helmet. It advertises that helmets provide 1-hit protection to the head. Some snipers bypass this and still kill you with 1 shot to the head.

This game is fun, but to make it fun you have to set aside the cheap shots that players can get on you across map.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would like to refute the notions that this game is a pay-to-win.
While I am frustrated with pay-to-wins in game, they really do not have much of an advantage.
Once you get to like level 4 and 6, you get some really good weapons that put you at a great advantage.
The game is super easy to get good at, and if you can aim, you can beat the pay-to-wins.

This game is enjoyable, and is actually quite fun.
The game features some (some) good maps, and the fact that you can build also adds a lot.
I understand that the game is still in its early stages, so I am willing to say that the developers can make improvements.
I would recommend this game, it is a unique combination of the FPS and almost sandbox genres.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Blockade 3D is a beautiful game. The graphics are on par with top tier games like Bad Rats, Unturned and Minecraft. It has all of the elements that a core shooter needs. Like guns. You can even get a shovel! And puts some guns like the L96A1 at a cheap price of around $3. Bargain! It only takes about 50 hours of full gametime to get a better gun, which still sucks, but you could just buy it for real money, which, lets be honest, would be money well spent.
It also looks a bit like Minecraft so you can't go wrong i guess. All around a great game that i would recommend for anyone who gets bullied and is looking to kill themselves. The memes are very fresh and the zombie mode is super sp00ky.
Once you get past the Russians it is a sensitive little boy that really wants to play with the other kids but is autisitic and can't because they make fun of him. As he cuts himself he wonders about a game that could be worse than his autism, and Blockade 3D was born. Honestly can't wait till the sequel, BLOCKADE 4D, the hype is real.
I want my life back/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tl;Dr: I cannot recommend the game; The game is pay to win and the community is quite bad. However, when these issues aren't too prominent the game is fun.

Yeah, I had a review before that said that this game wasn't pay to win and was actually good.

Needless to say, I pulled that because that was not correct. I really wanted this game to be good, but I can't honestly say it is.

It's pay to win
Non-paying players cannot get helmets or armor, which gives an unfair advantage to paying players. Having played both with and without armor, I can honestly say that I got a better K:D ratio with armor on. Also, I bought a high-capacity gun, giving more of a noticable advantage. Finally, though I did not buy this, you can pay for a premium" account (which is a subscription). This gives you double experience. Again
date:
I did not buy this but this is how it is advertised and is stated by other players.

The community is terrible
This isn't something I usually like to say is bad about a game
recommended: but it's pretty terrible. I've argued with BeastX
hoursPlayed: the top #1 player. He heavily insisted that the game was not pay to win
voteText: despite the fact he actually stated it was pay to win (he stated that the game gave an advantage to paying players). Also
helpfulPercent: he calls those who don't want to pay "poor kids." Keep in mind that this is exactly how the majority of the community thinks and acts. They reject those that talk badly of the game
votesHelpful: saying that they are bad or poor.\n\nAlso
votesTotal: I've been called racist terms and have been in a server when someone started chanting "F*** AMERICA." The non-American portion of the community can be quite hostile towards Americans.\n\nHowever
votesFunny: it is still a bit fun\nWhen the previously mentioned issues aren't being particually bothersome
commentsCount: the game is fun. I've gotten good kill sprees and the game is
column16: on paper
column21: the game would be very good.\n\nStill
column22: I cannot honestly set the review as a recommend. The fact is that the two issues I mentioned are far too prominent."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFirst of all many of you say that this game has lag, if that is true then you must be playing this game on a calculator with a internet conection of 1 nanobyte per second because i run this game on a small notebook with only 4 gigabytes of ram and a processor that is quite horrible. second of course the game has crappy micro-transactions, but they are not bye far pay to win. i have not once felt that if i paid real money in this game that i would have a better chance of winning plus if you actually play the game you can rank up and get free stuff. Third I have tons of fun playing this with my friends, most of the ime i spent on this game was playing a bunch of different game modes with my friends on skype. Of course the game copies cod and it also is some what glitchy at times but all of it isnt as bad a experience as people are making it out to be plus its free and entertaining even with its problems. Over all looking at other peoples reviews most of the things are true, the only thing I dont agree with is the claim of lag problems. I for one recommend this game it is entertaining for different reasons, so OVER ALL i give this game a 6.5 and i recommend this game to anyone who wants to have free fun

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To be honest, I like this game. I don't know why people hate this game so much, But to me, its fun.

Here are some pros and cons about this game:

Pros:
Fairly fun gameplay.
The game has Great Customizations to your character. (Guns, Knifes, etc...)
The shops prices are fair.
Variety of different maps, most of them are fun.

Cons:
P2W players can ruin the fun for F2P players.
The graphics are not as appealing.
The physics are not as good.
It's a ripoff of Ace of Spades.

This game is not good, But it's ok. I was not having much fun when i was a F2P player. But once i bought some stuff from the shop, I was nearly impossible to kill. Mainly because i had a HELMETPLUS and a VESTPLUS to protect myself. Basically this means i'm a P2W player, and the F2P players are not having as much fun because of me. The HELMETPLUS and the VESTPLUS are considered the most powerful items in the game, because they offer defense. At the start of playing this game, you have no defense. Many F2P players HATE these items because they think it's unfair to them.

To be honest, I agree. But what matters is that i am having fun with everyone, and i'm having fun playing this game. Even though it's a bit P2W, its a great experience for me, and it could be a great experience for you.

Overall Rating: 6.5/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nHello Guys, some of you might know me in game. I am a lvl 21 and I recommend this game. This game is amazing and it is the most easiest game to play, slappybird223 is right as well. most people who complain are not even to a rank to earn weapons. It is a a mix of a pay-to-win but you can earn weapons as well so just hang in there! I never spend any money in a game so much until i was a level 7 and my first gun that i earned was the AUG and which it is OP (overpowered) and is the best gun to get at a young level. Yes you may come across some hot heads that they think that they are hot ♥♥♥♥ because they can get 300 kills with out dying 30 times, but there are other servers you can choose through. Dont beat yourself up because you cant get a kill, with the starter guns it is hard but dont worry it will get easier once you have a feel for this game. If you dont like this game then that is alright! There is many other great games out on steam! Anyways I hope that you liked my Opinion on the game and feel free to add me on steam! If you have a question please msg (message) me anytime when i am online! Have a great day!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before you flame HEAR ME OUT. I've played for about an hour or so and at it's core this game is very fun to play. First game I went 136-23. It's pretty easy and it was fun stomping scrubs with loads of nondefault weapons. You also get grenades and rockets and weapons for free from leveling up, I'll admit the dollar weapon here and 2 dollars there ♥♥♥♥ seems pretty sketchy and I suggest they allow us to buy grenades and rockets and stuff with in game money. Pretty sure you unlock the body armor at a certain level too.. Anyways, they pretty much screwed up the microtransactions but for me not having spent any money on it I had quite a bit of fun with it.

Yeah, that's right I was entertained.. FOR FREE

In conclusion, allow everything to be bought with ingame tokens of some kind and it would be solid. How it is right now is pretty lame but they gotta make money I guess!

Where do I put my epic 'uninstalled xDDD' copy paste in this review?! I need to fit in!!!!!!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

No matter what many reviews say, this game is not Pay to Win.
All it takes to win in this game is by being a good shooter. I went all the way up to level 6 and was in the lead in almost every single match, and I didn't spend a cent. Only after I reached level 6 I treated myself to some extra gear for $8.
This game is great! Once you get the hang of headshots, you can win every match with the standard rifle. You do have the occasional kid who gets on everybody's nerves, but I like to solve that problem with a grenade. Playing with a friend also makes the game much more fun.
So yes, I do recommend this game. Just beware that there are some pretty good, fair playing, players out there; you will need to be a good First-Person-Shooter shooter!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well after so many negative Reviews i thought i would write my own ^^

Yes its pay to win, but not that much...
everyone saying you dont need skill, just money probably played it for 2 hours and then uninstalled it..
Of course the 3 starter weapons are sh*tty as hell... but if you play for more than one day you'll get an Ak on level 6 a SVD on... 11 i think, and a RPK on level 13..
All 3 of them are quite some decent weapons (RPK is overpowered as f*ck :D)
Even after buying 2 weapons, i still play the RPK a lot!

You don't need skill? of course you do!
i've seen both. noobs with armor who got f*cked by everyone (including free players)
and free players who made quite some kills with the stuff they have.

Everyone is whining about hackers...
Since the first big hacker-ban i haven't seen a single one!
maybe you just suck ;P i got called a hacker a few times too, and im not too much of a pro
(K/D of around 3:1 up to 10:1... depends on the enemy team :P)

But you definitely can play this game without paying!

And even if you do, with a decent amount of money, you can be equipped as good as some others are who blow their cash in this game. most money goes into tons of weapons.
you'll get some armor, a skin and a nice weapon for under 5 bucks...

If you dont want to spend that much, buy some armor for ~1.50€ and play with the RPK.
Combined with some skill you'll get tons of kills even without spending lots of money.


Guess thats all ^^
Hope it was helpful for a few of you..
(And im sorry for my lack of english skills but i think you'll get the point ^^)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nTerrible in my opinion. Its an ok shooter but almost everything costs real money. They give out some free stuff in earlier ranks. Like a rocket launcher with expendable ammo(The ammo stays the same throughout games except for primary guns). If you don't like generic first person shooters with minecraft like mechanics, than don't get. Honestly, to me, it should be less than free! (Obviously thats not a thing but just roll with it). the least they could have done with this is make it an option to pay for guns, but there is in-game currency to help kind of balance it out. I always play P2W games but I always play for free. Of course that limits me a lot, but I deal with it. But this... this... its just... terrible...terrible terrible.
